B2 the ability to control your fear in a dangerous or difficult situation: They showed great courage when they found out about their baby's disability. [ + to infinitive ] People should have the courage to stand up for their beliefs. It took me months to summon/pluck up the courage to ask for a promotion. Synonym
bravery

have the courage of your convictions
to be brave and confident enough to do what you believe in: Although many of his policies were unpopular, he had the courage of his convictions to see them through.
